- John is an ancestor of Keith (since Keith is John's descendant). So John is above Keith.

We need to see if there is any common ancestor or common descendant linking Terry and John.

Alternatively, see if any relationship linking Brittany to John or Keith etc.

First, find all ancestors of Terry (starting from Brittany). Then find all descendants of John (starting from Keith). Then see if any person appears in both sets.

Alternatively, find any path from Terry to John.

We need to handle transitive closure: If X is descendant of Y, then Y is ancestor of X; and descendant relationship is transitive: if X desc Y, and Y desc Z, then X desc Z. Similarly, ancestor relationship is transitive.

Thus we can compute ancestors and descendants.

We need to find relationship between Terry and John. Options: share common descendant (both are ancestors of some same person), share common ancestor (both are descendants of some same person), Terry is John's ancestor, Terry is John's descendant, none.

Thus we need to see if any path from Terry to John (descendant/ancestor) exists.

Check if John is descendant of Terry: need a path from Terry to John via descendant relationships: X is descendant of Y means X is lower generation. So John is ancestor of Keith. So John is older generation relative to Keith.

Thus John is not descendant of Terry unless there is some path like John is descendant of some person who is descendant of Terry. But we have no such statements.

Thus likely answer is either share common ancestor or share common descendant or none.
